Award.AbstractNarration: Dr. Medea Csoba DeHass will travel to Dartmouth College to meet with a prospective mentor, Dr. Sergei Kan. During the trip, Dr. Csoba DeHass will further discuss her proposed postdoctoral project on Sugpiaq ethnohistory with Dr. Kan, meet the researchers of the Institute of Arctic Studies at Dartmouth College, as well as discuss professional development and teaching opportunities during her proposed postdoctoral tenure.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
The award was used by the PI, Medea Csoba-DeHass, to travel to Hanover, NH to meet her proposed mentor, Dr. Sergei Kan, and the faculty of the Institute of Arctic Studies and the Native American Studies Program at Dartmouth College.

 

After establishing mutual research interests by email, the PI and the proposed sponsoring scientist sought the support of the National Science Foundation Postdoctoral Travel Grant to continue their discussion on the PI’s proposed postdoctoral project in person.

 

In accordance with the Office of Polar Programs Post Doctoral Fellowship Solicitation, the PI completed the trip to the proposed host institution and explored various professional development opportunities during the visit. Additionally, the PI also worked with Dr. Kan in developing a postdoctoral fellowship application on Sugpiaq Ethnohistory. The travel grant helped the PI to write a postdoctoral fellowship application that was favorably reviewed by the National Science Foundation and subsequently recommended for funding. Dr. Kan’s expertise in ethnohistory provided significant input to the PI’s postdoctoral project, which promises to explore the processes inherent in Native peoples’ adaptive historical interpretation, as well as providing a venue for the expression of culture specific historical representation through collaborative work. The PI begins work on the postdoctoral project in August 2011 as a National Science Foundation Postdoctoral Fellow at Dartmouth College.
